title: Electrolyte solution having ionic liquid and lithium-ion battery having the same

events.title: Application filed by China Petrochemical Development Corp
Assigned to CHINA PETROCHEMICAL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION, TAIPEI (TAIWAN)
description: ASSIGNMENT OF ASSIGNORS INTEREST (SEE DOCUMENT FOR DETAILS).
Assignors: CHANG, HAO-HSUN, LIU, JUNG-JUNG, WANG, FU-MING

classifications.description: Accumulators with non-aqueous electrolyte characterised by the materials used as electrolytes, e.g. mixed inorganic/organic electrolytes
Liquid materials characterised by the solutes
Room temperature molten salts comprising at least one organic ion
Energy storage systems for electromobility, e.g. batteries

abstract:
The present invention provides an electrolyte solution including an ionic liquid having the structure of formula (I):
wherein R1 is C1-C6alkyl, R2 is C2-C7alkyl, A− is defined in the specification. The electrolyte solution of the present invention has high conductivity and high thermal stability.
claims:
1. An electrolyte solution, comprising:
an organic solvent; a lithium salt; and 0.1 wt % to 50 wt % of an ionic liquid based on a total weight of the electrolyte solution.

2. The electrolyte solution of claim 1, wherein the ionic liquid has a structure of the following formula (I):
      
        
          
          
             
             
          
        
      
      wherein R1 is C1-C6alkyl; R2 is C2-C7alkyl; A− is one selected from the group consisting of the following groups: HSO4 −,
      
        
          
          
             
             
          
        
      
      wherein X in the formula (II) and formula (III) is F, Cl, Br or I.

3. The electrolyte solution of claim 1, wherein the organic solvent is at least one selected from the group consisting of γ-butyrolactone, ethylene carbonate, propylene carbonate, diethyl carbonate, propyl acetate, dimethyl carbonate and ethylmethyl carbonate.
4. The electrolyte solution of claim 1, wherein the lithium salt is a benzimidazolium salt.

5. The electrolyte solution of claim 1, wherein the lithium salt includes at least one selected from the group consisting of LiPF6, LiBF4, LiAsF6, LiSbF6, LiClO, LiAlCl4, LiGaCl4, LiNO3, LiC(SO2CF3)3, LiN(SO2CF3)2, LiSCN, LiO3SCF2CF3, LiC6F5SO3, LiO2CCF3, LiSO3F, LiB(C6H5)4, LiBOB and LiCF3SO3.
6. A lithium-ion battery, comprising the electrolyte solution of claim 1.

7. The lithium-ion battery of claim 6, further comprising:
an anode; a cathode; and an isolation film disposed between the anode and the cathode and having a through hole, wherein the anode, the cathode and the isolation film form a receiving space for receiving the electrolyte solution of claim 1.

8. The lithium-ion battery of claim 7, wherein the anode comprises:
a first conducting component; and an anode metal film formed on the first conducting component, wherein the isolation film is disposed on the first conducting component, and the through hole of the isolation film exposes a part of the first conducting component; and 
      the cathode comprises:
a second conducting component; and
a cathode metal film formed on the second conducting component, wherein the second conducting component is disposed between the isolation film and the cathode metal film, and the isolation film, the first conducting component and the second conducting component form the receiving space for receiving the electrolyte solution of claim 1.
9. The lithium-ion battery of claim 7, further comprising an encapsulation structure encapsulating the anode, the cathode and the isolation film.

10. The lithium-ion battery of claim 8, wherein the first conducting component is at least one selected from the group consisting of lithium, an alloy, a metal oxide, a nitride, a silicon material, a vanadate, a sulfide, a phosphorus compound and a carbon compound.
11. The lithium-ion battery of claim 10, wherein the alloy is made of at least two selected from the group consisting of Mg, Ca, Al, Ge, Sn, Pb, As, Sb, Bi, Ag, Au, Zn, Cd, Hg, Ni, Cu, Mn and Fe.

12. The lithium-ion battery of claim 10, wherein the metal oxide is one selected from the group consisting of TiO2, Li4Ti5O12-y, Cu2O, CuO, CoOCo3O4, NiO, FeO, Fe2O3, Fe3O4, CuFe2O4, NiFe2O4, CoFe2O4, MgO, MnV2O6, MnMoO4, WO2, MoO2Nb2O5, SnO and SnO2, in which y is in a range from 0 to 0.1.
13. The lithium-ion battery of claim 10, wherein the silicon material is at least one selected from the group consisting of Si, Mg2Si, NiSi, CaSi, Cu3Si, Cu5Si and SiOx, in which x is 1 or 2.
14. The lithium-ion battery of claim 10, wherein the carbon compound is at least one selected from the group consisting of a carbon powder, graphite, a carbon fiber, a nano carbon tube and graphene.
15. The lithium-ion battery of claim 14, wherein an average diameter of the carbon powder is in a range from 100 nm to 30 μm.
16. The lithium-ion battery of claim 14, wherein the carbon powder is at least one selected from the group consisting of amorphous carbon, graphite-like carbon and a mesocarbon microbead.
17. The lithium-ion battery of claim 8, wherein the second conducting component includes a transition metal oxide mixed with lithium.

18. The lithium-ion battery of claim 17, wherein the transition metal oxide mixed with lithium is one selected from the group consisting of LiMnO2, LiMn2O4, LiCoO2, Li2Cr2O7, Li2CrO4, LiNiO2, LiFeO2, LiMPO4Fq, LiMSiO4, Li2MSiO4, LiM1 (1-r)M2 rPO4, LiM1 (1-r)M2 rSiO4, Li2M1 (1-r)M2 rSiO4, LiMn0.5Ni0.5O2, Li1.15-αMnβCOχNiδO2-σ and LiMc0.5Mn1.5O4, wherein p, q and r are respectively in a range from 0 to 1, M is Ni, Co, Mn or Fe, M1 and M2 are independently Ni, Co, Mn, Fe, Zn, Zr, Mg, Ag, Al, Sb or Cr, α is in a range from 0 to 0.5, the sum of β, χ and δ is 1, σ is in a range from 0 to 0.5, and Mc is a divalent transition metal.
19. The lithium-ion battery of claim 8, wherein the second conducting component is TiS2, V2O5 or MoO3.

20. The lithium-ion battery of claim 8, further comprising a binder for binding the anode metal film to the first conducting component and binding the cathode metal film to the second conducting component.

21. The lithium-ion battery of claim 20, wherein the binded is made of a material selected from the group consisting of poly(vinylidene fluoride), styrene butadeine rubber, polyamide, and melamine resin.
22. The lithium-ion battery of claim 7, wherein the isolation film is polyethylene, polypropylene, or a combination thereof.
